title: Representing SHM - equation from spring constant

content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is attached to a horizontal spring with spring constant <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math> and undergoes simple harmonic motion with amplitude <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math> along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis. Which of the following equations could represent the position <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> of the object as a function of time?

choices.label: <math alttext="x equals A times the cosine of, open bracket, open parenthesis, the square root of the fraction k over m, close parenthesis, t, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mfrac><mi>k</mi><mi>m</mi></mfrac></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="x equals A times the cosine of, open bracket, open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over 2 pi, end fraction, times the square root of the fraction k over m, close parenthesis, t, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><msqrt><mfrac><mi>k</mi><mi>m</mi></mfrac></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="x equals A times the cosine of, open bracket, 2 pi times, open parenthesis, the square root of the fraction m over k, close parenthesis, t, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mfrac><mi>m</mi><mi>k</mi></mfrac></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="x equals A times the cosine of, open bracket, 4 pi squared, open parenthesis, the square root of the fraction m over k, close parenthesis, t, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn><msup><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mfrac><mi>m</mi><mi>k</mi></mfrac></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="x equals A times the cosine of, open bracket, open parenthesis, the square root of the fraction k over m, close parenthesis, t, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mfrac><mi>k</mi><mi>m</mi></mfrac></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
